item.title: Efficiency
item.description: The terms “efficiency” and “performance” are often used interchangeably when discussing data structures, but they have distinct meanings. Concept Definition Efficiency refers to the theoretical measure of how well a data structure utilizes resources, particularly time and space. It’s usually analyzed using Big O notation, which describes how the time or space complexity of a data structure grows as the input size increases. Performance is a more practical measure of how well a data structure actually performs on a specific platform or with a specific set of data.
